question_text:
Question 22 
 
  
[Database (Database Design Function)]
 
 
Which of the following statements about a relation 
R
 in first normal form (1 NF) is/are TRUE ? 
 
(A) 
R
 can have a multi-attribute key
 
 
 
(B) 
R
 cannot have a foreign key

PAGE
19

(C) 
R
 cannot have a composite attribute
 
 
 
(D) 
R
 cannot have more than one candidate key 
Ans. 
(A,C)
explanation_text:
Sol.
 
In (1 NF) or 
m
 the relation 
R
 can have a multi-attribute key also if can’t have a composite attribute.
First normal form (1 NF) :

 
can have composite key (multi-attribute key)

 
must have atleast one candidate key

 
not allowed multi-valued attributes

 
every attribute of 
R
 must be atomic

 
not allowed composite attributes

 
may consist foreign keys
Hence, the correct option is (A) and (C).
